title: Ticket #6961: condor_gpu_discovery prints not-valid-for-config errors
description:
At least on Windows, it's possible for certain error messages to be printed without the comment prefix, meaning that the output of condor_gpu_discovery will no longer be valid. For instance, running 'condor_gpu_discovery -extra -dynamic -prop' on a system with NVidia drivers but without CUDA installed will fail to determine the CUDA runtime version (of course), but print a message while doing so that will prevent the other information from making it into the machine ad.

The bug may be as simple as changing g_config_syntax to be initialized to 1, but I'll let TJ decide.
remarks:
2019-Mar-19 18:16:12 by tlmiller:
This may only be fixed for 8.8.2 if it's a simple as changing the variable initialization; it's otherwise rather close to the code freeze.
